intro: Eupatorium bupleurifolium, commonly known as the Florida blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. It produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a distinctive appearance.
